parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: Latitude of the waypoint.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: Longitude of the waypoint.

methods.name: addWaypoint(latitude, longitude)
methods.description: Adds a waypoint that the route must pass through, using a point (lat/lng).

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: An address.

methods.name: addWaypoint(address)
methods.description: Adds a waypoint that the route must pass through, using an address.

methods.name: clearWaypoints()
methods.description: Clears the current set of waypoints.

methods.name: getDirections()
methods.description: Gets the directions using the origin, destination, and other options that were set.

parameters.name: useAlternatives
parameters.description: true to return alternative routes, false otherwise

methods.name: setAlternatives(useAlternatives)
methods.description:
Sets whether or not alternative routes should be returned, instead of just the highest ranked
route (defaults to false). If true, the resulting object'sroutesarray may
contain multiple entries.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: the time of arrival

methods.name: setArrive(time)
methods.description: Sets the desired time of arrival (when applicable).

parameters.name: avoid
parameters.description: a constant value fromAvoid

methods.name: setAvoid(avoid)
methods.description: Sets whether to avoid certain types of restrictions.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: the time of departure

methods.name: setDepart(time)
methods.description: Sets the desired time of departure (when applicable).

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: the latitude of the ending location

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: the longitude of the ending location

methods.name: setDestination(latitude, longitude)
methods.description: Sets the ending location for which to calculate directions to, using a point (lat/lng).

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: the ending address

methods.name: setDestination(address)
methods.description: Sets the ending location for which to calculate directions to, using an address.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: a BCP-47 language identifier

methods.name: setLanguage(language)
methods.description: Sets the language to be used for the directions.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: a constant value fromMode

methods.name: setMode(mode)
methods.description: Sets the mode of travel (defaults to driving).

parameters.name: optimizeOrder
parameters.description: true to optimize the order, or false otherwise

methods.name: setOptimizeWaypoints(optimizeOrder)
methods.description:
Sets whether or not to optimize the provided route by rearranging the waypoints in a more
efficient order (defaults to false).

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: the latitude of the starting location

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: the longitude of the starting location

methods.name: setOrigin(latitude, longitude)
methods.description: Sets the starting location from which to calculate directions, using a point (lat/lng).

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: the starting address

methods.name: setOrigin(address)
methods.description: Sets the starting location from which to calculate directions, using an address.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: the region code to use

methods.name: setRegion(region)
methods.description:
Sets a region to use when interpreting location names. The supported region codes correspond to
the ccTLDs supported by Google Maps. For example, the region code "uk" corresponds to
"maps.google.co.uk".

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: the latitude of the point to sample

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: the longitude of the point to sample

methods.name: sampleLocation(latitude, longitude)
methods.description: Returns elevation data for a single point (lat/lng).

parameters.name: points
parameters.description: an array of latitude/longitude pairs

methods.name: sampleLocations(points)
methods.description: Returns elevation data for a series of points (lat/lng).

parameters.name: encodedPolyline
parameters.description: an encoded polyline of points to sample

methods.name: sampleLocations(encodedPolyline)
methods.description: Returns elevation data for the points in an encoded polyline.

parameters.name: points
parameters.description: an array of latitude/longitude pairs defining a path to sample over

parameters.name: numSamples
parameters.description: the number of points to sample along the path of points

methods.name: samplePath(points, numSamples)
methods.description: Returns elevation data for a number of samples along a line, defined using a series of points.

parameters.name: encodedPolyline
parameters.description: an encoded polyline of points defining a path to sample over

parameters.name: numSamples
parameters.description: the number of points to sample along the path of points

methods.name: samplePath(encodedPolyline, numSamples)
methods.description: Returns elevation data for a number of samples along a line, defined using an encoded polyline.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: an address

methods.name: geocode(address)
methods.description: Gets the approximate geographic points for a given address.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: the latitude of the point

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: the longitude of the point

methods.name: reverseGeocode(latitude, longitude)
methods.description: Gets the approximate addresses for a given geographic point.

parameters.name: swLatitude
parameters.description: the latitude of the south west corner of the bounds

parameters.name: swLongitude
parameters.description: the longitude of the south west corner of the bounds

parameters.name: neLatitude
parameters.description: the latitude of the north east corner of the bounds

parameters.name: neLongitude
parameters.description: the longitude of the north east corner of the bounds

methods.name: setBounds(swLatitude, swLongitude, neLatitude, neLongitude)
methods.description: Sets the bounds of an area that should be given extra preference in the results.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: a BCP-47 language identifier

methods.name: setLanguage(language)
methods.description: Sets the language to be used in the results.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: the region code to use

methods.name: setRegion(region)
methods.description:
Sets a region to use when interpreting location names. The supported region codes correspond to
the ccTLDs supported by Google Maps. For example, the region code "uk" corresponds to
"maps.google.co.uk".

parameters.name: polyline
parameters.description: An encoded polyline to decode.

methods.name: decodePolyline(polyline)
methods.description: Decodes an encoded polyline string back into an array of points.

parameters.name: points
parameters.description: An array of latitude/longitude pairs to encode.

methods.name: encodePolyline(points)
methods.description: Encodes an array of points into a string.

methods.name: newDirectionFinder()
methods.description: Creates a new DirectionFinder object.

methods.name: newElevationSampler()
methods.description: Creates an ElevationSampler object.

methods.name: newGeocoder()
methods.description: Creates a new Geocoder object.

methods.name: newStaticMap()
methods.description: Creates a new StaticMap object.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: A client identifier.

parameters.name: signingKey
parameters.description: A private signing key.

methods.name: setAuthentication(clientId, signingKey)
methods.description:
Enables the use of an externally establishedGoogle Maps APIs Premium Planaccount,
to leverage additionalquota
allowances. Your client ID and signing key can be obtained from the Google Enterprise
Support Portal. Set these values tonullto go back to using the default quota
allowances.

enum_members.name: TINY
enum_members.description: Tiny sized markets (smallest available). Labels will not be visible on markers of this size.

enum_members.name: SMALL
enum_members.description: Small sized markers. Labels will not be visible on markers of this size.

enum_members.name: WALKING
enum_members.description: Walking directions via pedestrian paths and sidewalks (where available).

enum_members.name: BICYCLING
enum_members.description: Bicycling directions via bicycle paths and preferred streets (where available).

enum_members.name: TRANSIT
enum_members.description:
Transit directions via public transit routes (where available). This mode requires that you set
either the departure or arrival time.// Log all available data for a public-transit trip.constdirections=Maps.newDirectionFinder().setOrigin('The Cloisters, New York, NY').setDestination('JFK airport, New York, NY').setMode(Maps.DirectionFinder.Mode.TRANSIT).setDepart(newDate()).getDirections();constroute=directions.routes[0];Logger.log(route);

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: An address to add.

methods.name: addAddress(address)
methods.description: Adds a new address to the current path definition.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: The latitude of the new marker.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: The longitude of the new marker.

methods.name: addMarker(latitude, longitude)
methods.description: Adds a marker to the map using a point (lat/lng).

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The address at which to place the new marker.

methods.name: addMarker(address)
methods.description: Adds a marker to the map using an address.

parameters.name: points
parameters.description: An array of latitude/longitude pairs that define the path.

methods.name: addPath(points)
methods.description: Adds a path to the map using an array of points.

parameters.name: polyline
parameters.description: An encoded polyline.

methods.name: addPath(polyline)
methods.description: Adds a path to the map using an encoded polyline.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: The latitude of the point.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: The longitude of the point.

methods.name: addPoint(latitude, longitude)
methods.description: Adds a new point (lat/lng) to the current path definition.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: The latitude of the point.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: The longitude of the point.

methods.name: addVisible(latitude, longitude)
methods.description: Adds a point (lat/lng) location that must be visible in the map.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: An address that must be visible in the map.

methods.name: addVisible(address)
methods.description: Adds an address location that must be visible in the map.

methods.name: beginPath()
methods.description:
Starts a new path definition. Calls toaddAddress()andaddPoint()define each
new vertex in the path. The path is completed whenendPath()is called.

methods.name: clearMarkers()
methods.description: Clears the current set of markers.

methods.name: clearPaths()
methods.description: Clear the current set of paths.

methods.name: clearVisibles()
methods.description: Clears the current set of visible locations.

methods.name: endPath()
methods.description: Completes a path definition started with beginPath().

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The MIME type to convert to. For most blobs,'application/pdf'is
    the only valid option. For images in BMP, GIF, JPEG, or PNG format, any of'image/bmp','image/gif','image/jpeg', or'image/png'are also
    valid. For a Google Docs document,'text/markdown'is also valid.

methods.name: getAs(contentType)
methods.description:
Return the data inside this object as a blob converted to the specified content type. This
method adds the appropriate extension to the filenameâ€”for example, "myfile.pdf". However, it
assumes that the part of the filename that follows the last period (if any) is an existing
extension that should be replaced. Consequently, "ShoppingList.12.25.2014" becomes
"ShoppingList.12.25.pdf".

methods.name: getBlob()
methods.description: Gets the image data as aBlob.

methods.name: getMapImage()
methods.description: Gets the raw image data as a byte array.

methods.name: getMapUrl()
methods.description: Gets the URL of the map image.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: The latitude of the center.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: The longitude of the center.

methods.name: setCenter(latitude, longitude)
methods.description: Sets the center of the map using a point (lat/lng).

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The address of the center.

methods.name: setCenter(address)
methods.description: Sets the center of the map using an address.

parameters.name: imageUrl
parameters.description:
Specifies a URL to use as the marker's custom icon. Images may be in PNG, JPEG
    or GIF formats, though PNG is recommended.

parameters.name: useShadow
parameters.description:
Indicates that the marker should have a shadow generated, based on the image's
    visible region and its opacity/transparency.

methods.name: setCustomMarkerStyle(imageUrl, useShadow)
methods.description:
Sets the custom marker image to use when creating new markers. Markers that have already been
added are not affected.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: A constant value fromFormat.

methods.name: setFormat(format)
methods.description: Sets the format of the map image.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: A BCP-47 language identifier.

methods.name: setLanguage(language)
methods.description: Sets the language to be used for text on the map (where available).

parameters.name: mapType
parameters.description: A constant value fromType.

methods.name: setMapType(mapType)
methods.description: Sets the type of map to be shown.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: A constant value fromMarkerSize.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: A string in the format "0xrrggbb" or a constant value fromColor.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: A string containing a single character A-Z or 0-9.

methods.name: setMarkerStyle(size, color, label)
methods.description:
Sets the marker style to use when creating new markers. Markers that have already been added
are not affected.

parameters.name: useMobileTiles
parameters.description: Whether or not to use mobile tiles.

methods.name: setMobile(useMobileTiles)
methods.description: Sets whether or not to use specialized tile sets for mobile devices.

parameters.name: weight
parameters.description: The width of lines in pixels.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The line color, as a string in the format "0xrrggbb" or a constant value fromColor.

parameters.name: fillColor
parameters.description: The fill color, a string in the format "0xrrggbb" or a constant value fromColor.

methods.name: setPathStyle(weight, color, fillColor)
methods.description:
Sets the path style to use when creating new paths. Paths that have already been added are not
affected.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the image in pixels.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the image in pixels.

methods.name: setSize(width, height)
methods.description: Sets the width and height of the map image in pixels.

parameters.name: zoom
parameters.description: A value from zero to 21, inclusive.

methods.name: setZoom(zoom)
methods.description: Sets the zoom factor, or magnification level, used for the map.

enum_members.name: ROADMAP
enum_members.description: A standard roadmap, as is normally shown on the Google Maps website.

enum_members.name: TERRAIN
enum_members.description: A physical relief map, showing terrain and vegetation.

enum_members.name: HYBRID
enum_members.description:
A hybrid of the satellite and roadmap maps, showing a transparent layer of major streets and
place names on the satellite map.
